CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 8, 1950, page 54, reads: "Plan 'Town Meeting' Broadcast - The nation's top ranking radio and television forum, 'America's Town Meeting of the Air,' will be broadcast from Soldiers and Sailors Memorial Hall, April 18 at 8:30 P. M. The broadcast is sponsored by The Pittsburgh Courier as one of the highlights of its fortieth anniversary celebration. The Courier invited a number of Pittsburgh citizens, who represent all facets of community life, to serve as a Host Committee for the broadcast. Mrs. Robert L. Vann, publisher of the Courier, is general chairman, and Mayor David L. Lawrence is honorary chairman. Top photo: Mrs. Vann welcomes some of the committee at a meeting in the Chamber of Commerce last week. Lower photo, left to right, Mayor Lawrence and Mrs. Vann listen, while William Kelly, promotion manager of radio Station WCAE, an ABC outlet, explains details of the scheduled broadcast. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Jessie Vann, speaking to audience of women and men, gathered in the Chamber of Commerce as a  Host Committee for the "America's Town Meeting of the Air" WCAE broadcast
